step.tex: f(x) \text{ is a straight line for }x\gt 1.\\ f(x) \text{ is a parabola for }x\lt 1.\\ \text{Hence, it is continuous for all }x\neq 1.\\ \text{But we need to check for continuity \\ at x=1.}
step.reason: \text{Since, at x=1 the definition of the\\ function changes. So, x=1 is the only \\ problem point.}\\ \therefore\text{ we need to check continuity at x =1.}

step.tex:
\lim_{x\to 1^-}f(x) = \lim_{x\to 1^-} (x^2+1) =2\\ \lim_{x\to 1^+}f(x) = \lim_{x\to 1^+} (x+1) =2 \\ f(1)=(1)+1 = 2\\
\\ \text{Hence, f(x) is continuous at x=1.}\\
step.reason: \text{Since, f(x) is continuous at }x \neq 1\text{(step2)}\\ \text{So,there is no point of discontinuity.}\\
